[LEXICON]: Repeated use of placeholder terms ("a stuff", "the thing") instead of proper nouns or pronouns.
[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in sentences (e.g., "the years between 1749 and 1752, devoted by a thing to studying...").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between ideas (e.g., from Italian journey to apprenticeship details).
[STRUCTURE]: Overly fragmented paragraphs with loosely connected anecdotes (e.g., Dr. Johnson quote).
[CLARITY]: Ambiguous references (e.g., "the school of Bologna was in the ascendant in the thing").

[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in "the coach in which..." sentence.

[STRUCTURE]: Slight abruptness in transitioning to general artist commentary before returning to Reynolds.
